text: I'm not sure if this is the best place to post this but is there an Outlier detection package for singe variable time series?

elements.text: I'm not sure if this is the best place to post this but is there an Outlier detection package for singe variable time series?

text: Outlier detection can be done in a million different ways. Do you have any info about the type of outliers you are expecting to find in the data?

elements.text: Outlier detection can be done in a million different ways. Do you have any info about the type of outliers you are expecting to find in the data?

text: <https://juliahub.com/ui/Packages?t=outlier-detection> does not return many packages, two of them I have written that does outlier detection in particular ways, you may have a look at MatrixProfile to start out and see if it solves your problem. There are simpler ways of finding outliers than using the MatrixProfile though, so you might get away with something simpler

elements.text: does not return many packages, two of them I have written that does outlier detection in particular ways, you may have a look at MatrixProfile to start out and see if it solves your problem. text: I have some chaotic series data(EEG) and want to select outlier parts of it. initially I was thinking about a simple amplitude outlier in the signal and maybe a frequency outlier.

elements.text: I have some chaotic series data(EEG) and want to select outlier parts of it. initially I was thinking about a simple amplitude outlier in the signal and maybe a frequency outlier.

text:
```profile = matrix_profile(data, m)
anomalies(profile)```
might find something of interest
You can plot it as well
```plot(profile, anomalies(profile))```
if I remember correctly

elements.text:
might find something of interest
You can plot it as well

text: You can choose the distance as well, `DTW` might be a distance to consider for EEG data

elements.text: You can choose the distance as well,
might be a distance to consider for EEG data

text: Many thanks. I will take a look.
